49 namespace Internal {
50 
51 /** A code generator abstract base class. Actual code generators
52  * (e.g. CodeGen_X86) inherit from this. This class is responsible
53  * for taking a Halide Stmt and producing llvm bitcode, machine
54  * code in an object file, or machine code accessible through a
55  * function pointer.
56  */
57 class CodeGen_LLVM : public IRVisitor {
58 public:
59  /** Create an instance of CodeGen_LLVM suitable for the target. */
60  static std::unique_ptr<CodeGen_LLVM> new_for_target(const Target &target, llvm::LLVMContext &context);
61 
62  ~CodeGen_LLVM() override;
63 
64  /** Takes a halide Module and compiles it to an llvm Module. */
65  virtual std::unique_ptr<llvm::Module> compile(const Module &module);
66 
67  /** The target we're generating code for */
68  const Target &get_target() const {
69  return target;
70  }
71 
72  /** Tell the code generator which LLVM context to use. */
73  void set_context(llvm::LLVMContext &context);
74 
75  /** Initialize internal llvm state for the enabled targets. */
76  static void initialize_llvm();
77 
78  static std::unique_ptr<llvm::Module> compile_trampolines(
79  const Target &target,
80  llvm::LLVMContext &context,
81  const std::string &suffix,
82  const std::vector<std::pair<std::string, ExternSignature>> &externs);
83 
84  size_t get_requested_alloca_total() const {
85  return requested_alloca_total;
86  }
87 
88 protected:
89  CodeGen_LLVM(const Target &t);
90 
91  /** Compile a specific halide declaration into the llvm Module. */
92  // @{
93  virtual void compile_func(const LoweredFunc &func, const std::string &simple_name, const std::string &extern_name);
94  virtual void compile_buffer(const Buffer<> &buffer);
95  // @}
96 
97  /** Helper functions for compiling Halide functions to llvm
98  * functions. begin_func performs all the work necessary to begin
99  * generating code for a function with a given argument list with
100  * the IRBuilder. A call to begin_func should be a followed by a
101  * call to end_func with the same arguments, to generate the
102  * appropriate cleanup code. */
103  // @{
104  virtual void begin_func(LinkageType linkage, const std::string &simple_name,
105  const std::string &extern_name, const std::vector<LoweredArgument> &args);
106  virtual void end_func(const std::vector<LoweredArgument> &args);
107  // @}
108 
109  /** What should be passed as -mcpu, -mattrs, and related for
110  * compilation. The architecture-specific code generator should
111  * define these. */
112  // @{
113  virtual std::string mcpu() const = 0;
114  virtual std::string mattrs() const = 0;
115  virtual std::string mabi() const;
116  virtual bool use_soft_float_abi() const = 0;
117  virtual bool use_pic() const;
118  // @}
119 
120  /** Should indexing math be promoted to 64-bit on platforms with
121  * 64-bit pointers? */
122  virtual bool promote_indices() const {
123  return true;
124  }
125 
126  /** What's the natural vector bit-width to use for loads, stores, etc. */
127  virtual int native_vector_bits() const = 0;
128 
129  /** Return the type in which arithmetic should be done for the
130  * given storage type. */
131  virtual Type upgrade_type_for_arithmetic(const Type &) const;
132 
133  /** Return the type that a given Halide type should be
134  * stored/loaded from memory as. */
135  virtual Type upgrade_type_for_storage(const Type &) const;
136 
137  /** Return the type that a Halide type should be passed in and out
138  * of functions as. */
139  virtual Type upgrade_type_for_argument_passing(const Type &) const;
140

170  /** Grab all the context specific internal state. */
171  virtual void init_context();
172  /** Initialize the CodeGen_LLVM internal state to compile a fresh
173  * module. This allows reuse of one CodeGen_LLVM object to compiled
174  * multiple related modules (e.g. multiple device kernels). */
175  virtual void init_module();

183  /** Add an entry to the symbol table, hiding previous entries with
184  * the same name. Call this when new values come into scope. */
185  void sym_push(const std::string &name, llvm::Value *value);
186 
187  /** Remove an entry for the symbol table, revealing any previous
188  * entries with the same name. Call this when values go out of
189  * scope. */
190  void sym_pop(const std::string &name);
191 
192  /** Fetch an entry from the symbol table. If the symbol is not
193  * found, it either errors out (if the second arg is true), or
194  * returns nullptr. */
195  llvm::Value *sym_get(const std::string &name,
196  bool must_succeed = true) const;
197 
198  /** Test if an item exists in the symbol table. */
199  bool sym_exists(const std::string &name) const;

234  /** Emit code that evaluates an expression, and return the llvm
235  * representation of the result of the expression. */
236  llvm::Value *codegen(const Expr &);
237 
238  /** Emit code that runs a statement. */
239  void codegen(const Stmt &);

241  /** Codegen a vector Expr by codegenning each lane and combining. */
242  void scalarize(const Expr &);
243 
244  /** Some destructors should always be called. Others should only
245  * be called if the pipeline is exiting with an error code. */
246  enum DestructorType { Always,
247  OnError,
248  OnSuccess };
249 
250  /* Call this at the location of object creation to register how an
251  * object should be destroyed. This does three things:
252  * 1) Emits code here that puts the object in a unique
253  * null-initialized stack slot
254  * 2) Adds an instruction to the destructor block that calls the
255  * destructor on that stack slot if it's not null.
256  * 3) Returns that stack slot, so you can neuter the destructor
257  * (by storing null to the stack slot) or destroy the object early
258  * (by calling trigger_destructor).
259  */
260  llvm::Value *register_destructor(llvm::Function *destructor_fn, llvm::Value *obj, DestructorType when);
261 
262  /** Call a destructor early. Pass in the value returned by register destructor. */
263  void trigger_destructor(llvm::Function *destructor_fn, llvm::Value *stack_slot);
264 
265  /** Retrieves the block containing the error handling
266  * code. Creates it if it doesn't already exist for this
267  * function. */
268  llvm::BasicBlock *get_destructor_block();
269 
270  /** Codegen an assertion. If false, returns the error code (if not
271  * null), or evaluates and returns the message, which must be an
272  * Int(32) expression. */
273  // @{
274  void create_assertion(llvm::Value *condition, const Expr &message, llvm::Value *error_code = nullptr);
275  // @}
276 
277  /** Codegen a block of asserts with pure conditions */
278  void codegen_asserts(const std::vector<const AssertStmt *> &asserts);
279 
280  /** Codegen a call to do_parallel_tasks */
281  struct ParallelTask {
282  Stmt body;
283  struct SemAcquire {
284  Expr semaphore;
285  Expr count;
286  };
287  std::vector<SemAcquire> semaphores;
288  std::string loop_var;
289  Expr min, extent;
290  Expr serial;
291  std::string name;
292  };
293  int task_depth;
294  void get_parallel_tasks(const Stmt &s, std::vector<ParallelTask> &tasks, std::pair<std::string, int> prefix);
295  void do_parallel_tasks(const std::vector<ParallelTask> &tasks);
296  void do_as_parallel_task(const Stmt &s);

298  /** Return the the pipeline with the given error code. Will run

329  /** Get a unique name for the actual block of memory that an
330  * allocate node uses. Used so that alias analysis understands
331  * when multiple Allocate nodes shared the same memory. */
332  virtual std::string get_allocation_name(const std::string &n) {
333  return n;

336  using IRVisitor::visit;

338  /** Generate code for various IR nodes. These can be overridden by
339  * architecture-specific code to perform peephole
340  * optimizations. The result of each is stored in \ref value */
341  // @{
342  void visit(const IntImm *) override;
343  void visit(const UIntImm *) override;
344  void visit(const FloatImm *) override;
345  void visit(const StringImm *) override;

359  void visit(const GT *) override;

386  /** Generate code for an allocate node. It has no default
387  * implementation - it must be handled in an architecture-specific
388  * way. */
389  void visit(const Allocate *) override = 0;
390 
391  /** Generate code for a free node. It has no default
392  * implementation and must be handled in an architecture-specific
393  * way. */
394  void visit(const Free *) override = 0;
395

397  * lowering. CodeGen_LLVM will error out if they are present */
398  // @{

403  /** If we have to bail out of a pipeline midway, this should
404  * inject the appropriate target-specific cleanup code. */
405  virtual void prepare_for_early_exit() {
406  }

408  /** Get the llvm type equivalent to the given halide type in the
409  * current context. */
410  virtual llvm::Type *llvm_type_of(const Type &) const;
411 
412  /** Perform an alloca at the function entrypoint. Will be cleaned
413  * on function exit. */
414  llvm::Value *create_alloca_at_entry(llvm::Type *type, int n,
415  bool zero_initialize = false,
416  const std::string &name = "");
417 
418  /** A (very) conservative guess at the size of all alloca() storage requested
419  * (including alignment padding). It's currently meant only to be used as
420  * a very coarse way to ensure there is enough stack space when testing
421  * on the WebAssembly backend.
422  *
423  * It is *not* meant to be a useful proxy for "stack space needed", for a
424  * number of reasons:
425  * - allocas with non-overlapping lifetimes will share space
426  * - on some backends, LLVM may promote register-sized allocas into registers
427  * - while this accounts for alloca() calls we know about, it doesn't attempt
428  * to account for stack spills, function call overhead, etc.
429  */
430  size_t requested_alloca_total = 0;
431 
432  /** Which buffers came in from the outside world (and so we can't
433  * guarantee their alignment) */
434  std::set<std::string> external_buffer;
435 
436  /** The user_context argument. May be a constant null if the
437  * function is being compiled without a user context. */
438  llvm::Value *get_user_context() const;
439 
440  /** Implementation of the intrinsic call to
441  * interleave_vectors. This implementation allows for interleaving
442  * an arbitrary number of vectors.*/
443  virtual llvm::Value *interleave_vectors(const std::vector<llvm::Value *> &);
444 
445  /** Description of an intrinsic function overload. Overloads are resolved
446  * using both argument and return types. The scalar types of the arguments
447  * and return type must match exactly for an overload resolution to succeed. */
448  struct Intrinsic {
449  Type result_type;
450  std::vector<Type> arg_types;
451  llvm::Function *impl;
452 
453  Intrinsic(Type result_type, std::vector<Type> arg_types, llvm::Function *impl)
454  : result_type(result_type), arg_types(std::move(arg_types)), impl(impl) {
455  }
456  };
457  /** Mapping of intrinsic functions to the various overloads implementing it. */
458  std::map<std::string, std::vector<Intrinsic>> intrinsics;
459 
460  /** Get an LLVM intrinsic declaration. If it doesn't exist, it will be created. */
461  llvm::Function *get_llvm_intrin(const Type &ret_type, const std::string &name, const std::vector<Type> &arg_types, bool scalars_are_vectors = false);
462  llvm::Function *get_llvm_intrin(llvm::Type *ret_type, const std::string &name, const std::vector<llvm::Type *> &arg_types);
463  /** Declare an intrinsic function that participates in overload resolution. */
464  void declare_intrin_overload(const std::string &name, const Type &ret_type, const std::string &impl_name, std::vector<Type> arg_types, bool scalars_are_vectors = false);
465  void declare_intrin_overload(const std::string &name, const Type &ret_type, llvm::Function *impl, std::vector<Type> arg_types);
466  /** Call an overloaded intrinsic function. Returns nullptr if no suitable overload is found. */
467  llvm::Value *call_overloaded_intrin(const Type &result_type, const std::string &name, const std::vector<Expr> &args);
468 
469  /** Generate a call to a vector intrinsic or runtime inlined
470  * function. The arguments are sliced up into vectors of the width
471  * given by 'intrin_lanes', the intrinsic is called on each
472  * piece, then the results (if any) are concatenated back together
473  * into the original type 't'. For the version that takes an
474  * llvm::Type *, the type may be void, so the vector width of the
475  * arguments must be specified explicitly as
476  * 'called_lanes'. */
477  // @{
478  llvm::Value *call_intrin(const Type &t, int intrin_lanes,
479  const std::string &name, std::vector<Expr>);
480  llvm::Value *call_intrin(const Type &t, int intrin_lanes,
481  llvm::Function *intrin, std::vector<Expr>);
482  llvm::Value *call_intrin(llvm::Type *t, int intrin_lanes,
483  const std::string &name, std::vector<llvm::Value *>);
484  llvm::Value *call_intrin(llvm::Type *t, int intrin_lanes,
485  llvm::Function *intrin, std::vector<llvm::Value *>);
486  // @}
487 
488  /** Take a slice of lanes out of an llvm vector. Pads with undefs
489  * if you ask for more lanes than the vector has. */
490  virtual llvm::Value *slice_vector(llvm::Value *vec, int start, int extent);
491 
492  /** Concatenate a bunch of llvm vectors. Must be of the same type. */
493  virtual llvm::Value *concat_vectors(const std::vector<llvm::Value *> &);
494 
495  /** Create an LLVM shuffle vectors instruction. */
496  virtual llvm::Value *shuffle_vectors(llvm::Value *a, llvm::Value *b,
497  const std::vector<int> &indices);
498  /** Shorthand for shuffling a vector with an undef vector. */
499  llvm::Value *shuffle_vectors(llvm::Value *v, const std::vector<int> &indices);
500 
501  /** Go looking for a vector version of a runtime function. Will
502  * return the best match. Matches in the following order:
503  *
504  * 1) The requested vector width.
505  *
506  * 2) The width which is the smallest power of two
507  * greater than or equal to the vector width.
508  *
509  * 3) All the factors of 2) greater than one, in decreasing order.
510  *
511  * 4) The smallest power of two not yet tried.
512  *
513  * So for a 5-wide vector, it tries: 5, 8, 4, 2, 16.
514  *
515  * If there's no match, returns (nullptr, 0).
516  */
517  std::pair<llvm::Function *, int> find_vector_runtime_function(const std::string &name, int lanes);
518 
519  virtual bool supports_atomic_add(const Type &t) const;
520 
521  /** Compile a horizontal reduction that starts with an explicit
522  * initial value. There are lots of complex ways to peephole
523  * optimize this pattern, especially with the proliferation of
524  * dot-product instructions, and they can usefully share logic
525  * across backends. */
526  virtual void codegen_vector_reduce(const VectorReduce *op, const Expr &init);
527 
528  /** Are we inside an atomic node that uses mutex locks?
529  This is used for detecting deadlocks from nested atomics & illegal vectorization. */
530  bool inside_atomic_mutex_node;
531 
532  /** Emit atomic store instructions? */
533  bool emit_atomic_stores;
534 
535 private:
536  /** All the values in scope at the current code location during
537  * codegen. Use sym_push and sym_pop to access. */
538  Scope<llvm::Value *> symbol_table;
539 
540  /** String constants already emitted to the module. Tracked to
541  * prevent emitting the same string many times. */
542  std::map<std::string, llvm::Constant *> string_constants;
543 
544  /** A basic block to branch to on error that triggers all
545  * destructors. As destructors are registered, code gets added
546  * to this block. */
547  llvm::BasicBlock *destructor_block;
548 
549  /** Turn off all unsafe math flags in scopes while this is set. */
550  bool strict_float;
551 
552  /** Use the LLVM large code model when this is set. */
553  bool llvm_large_code_model;
554 
555  /** Embed an instance of halide_filter_metadata_t in the code, using
556  * the given name (by convention, this should be ${FUNCTIONNAME}_metadata)
557  * as extern "C" linkage. Note that the return value is a function-returning-
558  * pointer-to-constant-data.
559  */
560  llvm::Function *embed_metadata_getter(const std::string &metadata_getter_name,
561  const std::string &function_name, const std::vector<LoweredArgument> &args,
562  const std::map<std::string, std::string> &metadata_name_map);
563 
564  /** Embed a constant expression as a global variable. */
565  llvm::Constant *embed_constant_expr(Expr e, llvm::Type *t);
566  llvm::Constant *embed_constant_scalar_value_t(const Expr &e);
567 
568  llvm::Function *add_argv_wrapper(llvm::Function *fn, const std::string &name, bool result_in_argv = false);
569 
570  llvm::Value *codegen_dense_vector_load(const Load *load, llvm::Value *vpred = nullptr);
571 
572  virtual void codegen_predicated_vector_load(const Load *op);
573  virtual void codegen_predicated_vector_store(const Store *op);
574 
575  void codegen_atomic_store(const Store *op);
576 
577  void init_codegen(const std::string &name, bool any_strict_float = false);
578  std::unique_ptr<llvm::Module> finish_codegen();
579 
580  /** A helper routine for generating folded vector reductions. */
581  template<typename Op>
582  bool try_to_fold_vector_reduce(const Op *op);
583 };

587 /** Given a Halide module, generate an llvm::Module. */
588 std::unique_ptr<llvm::Module> codegen_llvm(const Module &module,
589  llvm::LLVMContext &context);

593 #endif
IRVisitor.h
Defines the base class for things that recursively walk over the IR.
Module.h
Defines Module, an IR container that fully describes a Halide program.
Scope.h
Defines the Scope class, which is used for keeping track of names in a scope while traversing IR.
Target.h
Defines the structure that describes a Halide target.
Halide::Buffer
